dialogues.text: The body of Victor Gonzales was found early this morning... INT. MITCH’S OFFICE - DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch watches on his computer.  60.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTER
dialogues.text: ..-floating just off shore. His family say the last time anyone saw him alive was at the North Mall on Saturday. Mitch sits there a beat. Stunned. Then stands and grabs h jacket. Secretary walks in with messages...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Not now. If Jones asks for me, I wasn’t feeling well. And Mitch is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch strides along the corridor. Hanging a “visitor pass around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch is sitting at a desk under harsh fluorescent lighti He opens the file. Spreads out photos of the Victor Gonzalez's broken body. Flips through pages of notes. We see words: “hammer” ... “rage” ... “tools” ... “torture” Mitch sits back. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch’s Escalade pulls into the familiar street and stops Mitch gets out and walks back to the exact spot of the hi and run. Looks down at the empty tarmac and sees --

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Ackerman in the rain looks up at him...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Mitch kneels down and looks around.  61.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A metallic SNAP in the darkness. Mitch looks through the rain toward a dark alley.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Mitch looks into the same alley, now lit by daylight, beh an old warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch walks slowly past dumpsters ... piles of trash. He looks back at the street. It affords the perfect view of accident site. Mitch turns his attention to the alley floor. Kicks aside trash and papers. Is about to give up when he notices -- A CIGARETTE FILTER lying on the ground. Mitch bends and picks it up. Looks at it. It’s been torn off.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Levy tears the filter off a cigarette outside court.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As Mitch looks around with renewed energy. On the brick wall, sheltered by a fire-escape, he sees a bloody smear. Mitch approaches and places his hand over it. It’s a hand print. Mitch sees another blood smear on the corner of a dumpste The wheels of Mitch’s mind turn and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! The rear doors of TOBIAS LEVY'S WHITE VAN burst ope and Ackerman bursts out through hanging, plastic sheets i the rain -- At first he looks almost fine - but then as he passes us see the back of his head is smashed -- blood soaking the of his clothes -- Ackerman runs -- barefoot -- slaps a hand against the bri wall. Dizzy from blood-loss. He clips the dumpster. Runs on. Eyes blinded with blood. Running toward the light...  62. INT. LEVY’S VAN — FLASHBACK -— CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy gets behind the wheel of the van and is about to fir the engine when he sees -- Ackerman runs out into the street and -- BAM! Mitch's BLACK ESCALADE hits him. Levy stops. Watches Mitch runs back into view and drop do beside the body of Ackerman. Levy calmly takes out a packet of cigarettes and pinches the filter. Drops it out the window. He lights the cigarette with his Zippo and then SNAPS it shut. Mitch looks toward the sound. Levy, safely swathed in darkness, smokes his cigarette. Casual. Unhurried. Enjoys the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch walks back to where the alley meets the road -- and looks at where Ackerman was lying that night and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman is lying in the rain. Mitch's Escalade zooming away. Suddenly a shadow falls over Ackerman and we see Le - looking down on him -- smoking casually. Levy grabs Ackerman by the collar and drags him -- whimpe and pleading -- back into the darkness of the alley... INT. POLICE STATION —- BACK BAY —- DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phones ring. The station bustles. Kanon is talking to another OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Detective Kanon. Kanon sees Mitch striding down the corridor...

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Not now, Brody, I’ve got a lot on my plate.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I need two minutes.  63.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Whatever case you're sniffing after this time, you can’t have.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: It’s about Victor Gonzales. Kanon looks at him... INT. KANON’S OFFICE - DAY Kanon dumps a stack of files on her desk and pops another Nicorette.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I think it was Levy.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Times up.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I’m serious. I saw him at the mall the same day as Gonzales.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: You saw Gonzales at the mall?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: We were buying baby clothes. That’s not important. Levy was watching Gonzales slap his wife around.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: So were you, it seems.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: The point is, I looked at the autopsy results and the wounds are similar to those found on Cecil Ackerman.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Ackerman was a hit and run. A COP in the corridor beckons Kanon. She gathers more pap and prepares to leave.  64.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What if it was both? What if Ackerman ran into the path of a car because he was trying to get away from Levy? It explains why the forensics were so confusing.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: I appreciate your enthusiasm, counselor, but I have to go... And Kanon is heading for the door --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Wait. You’re not listening to me -- Mitch grabs Kanon’s arm and --

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Sorry, I --

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: (now she’s pissed--) Now I’m guessing this was pretty hard on you, what with your impeccable track record and all, but a word of advice -- move on. Sometimes people lose cases! -- and Kanon leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pickup trucks pull in and out of the yard. Cars of all shapes and sizes are in the bays being repaired. Levy's white van is parked in the parking lot. Levy carries a primed Mustang fender into one of the bays. Mitch’s Escalade is parked across the street beyond the c link fence. INT. MITCH'’S ESCALADE — NIGHT Mitch watches the car mechanics clock off for the night. sees Levy walk to his white van. The van pulls out of the parking lot. Mitch ducks low in his seat as it passes, th sits up and fires the engine.  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy's white van drives through town. A couple of cars behind, Mitch’s Escalade follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch keeps his eyes on the back of the white van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy's van pulls up to the curb before a run-down two sto house. The small garden overgrown. Levy walks up the step and into the house as -- Mitch’s Escalade stops opposite. INT. MITCH’S ESCALADE - NIGHT Mitch loosens his tie and watches Levy's house. A light g on in the living room. Levy sits with a microwave meal in front of the TV. The clock on Mitch’s dash reads: 6:04pm. INT. MITCH’S ESCALADE (MOVING) - A SERIES OF SHOTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch’s follows Levy's white van. The clock now reads 7:55pm. They wind through the city streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy's van pulls into the parking lot where other cars ar arriving. Mitch pulls up across the street. INT. MITCH’S ESCALADE - NIGHT Mitch watches Levy shake the hands of MEN smoking outside Mitch watches as Levy pinches the filter off a cigarette lights it. Mitch watches Levy go inside with the other men. INT. CHURCH —- NIGHT Mitch walks inside and looks around. The main chapel is empty. He HEARS voices. Follows a short corridor to a church hall and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- sees a men’s group of some kind. Everyone sitting ina circle. Sharing. No sign of Levy. Where is he? Then Mitch sees him making coffee and laying out donuts on a table a the back of the room. Mitch picks up a flyer off the desk beside the door. Look at the words: “NARCOTICS ANONYMOUS”. Mitch looks back through the glass and sees Levy staring him. Mitch ducks aside.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BATHROOM — THE BRODY HOUSE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch stands under the hot water. Steam billows around hi Doesn’t know what the hell to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing. Nothing moves. INT. KITCHEN — THE BRODY HOUSE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty Chinese take-away cartons line the counter top. Dis are piled in the sink. A digital clock glows on the microwave. Changes from 03:06 to 03:07... INT. BEDROOM —- THE BRODY HOUSE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch is asleep in bed with Rachel. Ella is bundled safel in her bassinet. An ominous shadow falls over Mitch and w reveal --

dialogues.speaker: TOBIAS LEVY
dialogues.text: -- standing over him. He has a HAMMER clutched in his glo hand. He stares down at Mitch and -- Ella whimpers ... softly. It draws Levy’s attention. He crosses to the bassinet and looks down at the soft, fragi life it contains. He strokes Ella’s face with his gloved finger. His eyes and intent unreadable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Ella whimpers uncomfortably 0.S. and then ... silence. Dread builds and --  67.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH WAKES
dialogues.text: -- gasping from a bad dream. He throws back the covers an gets out of bed. Crosses to the bassinet. Ella is fine. Mitch breathes. It was just a dream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Paperboy cycles past. Slings the newspaper up the pat INT. GARAGE — THE BRODY HOUSE - MORNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch opens the door and walks in ready for work. He’s carrying a travel mug of coffee and his briefcase. He pop the locks on the Escalade and then notices -- The garden door stands open. Mitch crosses to it and look out into the garden. There’s nobody there. He locks the door, then turns and sees -- His organized wall of tools now has many holes. Pale silhouettes show what should be hanging there. Mitch then notices a small note pinned to the crib he was making. He walks closer and sees it’s not a note -- It’s a PHOTO of -- Mitch’s business card -- covered in dry blood.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Mitch pulls his jacket from Cecil Ackerman's fingers and business cards spill out. As Mitch quickly gathers them w REVEAL one under Ackerman's arm...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Mitch stares at the photo. Slips it in his pocket. Looks the wall of tools. At the space where a hammer used to ha That was no dream last night. Levy was in his house.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MITCH’S OFFICE - DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch is at his desk working. The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get my photo? Mitch tenses. Closes his office door.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars are jacked up on hydraulic lifts. Wheels are off. 68. Brakes replaced. A new V8 engine is being winched into th engine bay of a ‘69 Mustang. Levy is on a payphone in the breakroom.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: To talk.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You want to talk? I’1l talk. You ever come near my house or my family again, I will kill you. You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: I hear you. Do you hear me? Stop following me.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I was at the mall. I know what you did.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: And yet the police haven’t come knocking. Why is that, do you suppose? Mitch looks at the photo of the bloody business card.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: If you knew I was the driver, why didn’t you just turn me in?

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: Believe me, I was going to, but there was no point playing my ace at the station -- no -- they could have still come back to me -- even now -- I needed it to go to court -- I needed a jury of my peers to see your card and find me innocent.  69.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You wanted double jeopardy.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: Exactly. A free pass.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: But you didn’t expose me.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: There was no need. You were showing such a conscience. And from the moment you questioned that first expert I knew what you were planning. It was impressive, Mitch. It took balls.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Is this a fucking game to you?

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: Far from it.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I won’t let you get away with this.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: You will -- or I’1l ruin you -- and after you’re locked up for a hit and run -- who’ll look after Rachel and Ella?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: Family is a precious thing, Mitch. It’s our job as men to protect it. And Levy hangs up --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What does that mean? Levy? Mitch sits there listening to dead air. Gripping the phon with white knuckles. He slams it down. A look of grim determination on his face.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. POLICE STATION - BACK BAY — DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cruiser pulls out of the lot on patrol and passes --  70. INT. MITCH’S ESCALADE - DAY Mitch turns his face away until the cruiser has passed, t looks back at the station. He sees Kanon walk out and hea into the parking lot. Mitch climbs out and strides toward the station entrance. INT. POLICE STATION —- BACK BAY —- DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch walks in. Sees the Desk Sergeant at his post. He si beside a COUPLE OF DRUNK THUGS who are handcuffed and waiting.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: How long have you guys been waiting?

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK 1
dialogues.text: Two hours.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Did they offer you a soda? If they didn’t they can’t charge you, you know.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK 2
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: No shit, man. I work for the DA. Mitch flashes his ID. Drunks get up...

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK 1
dialogues.text: Hey, where's my motherfucking, soda?

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGANT
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK 1
dialogues.text: I know my rights, man. Give me my soda or cut me the fuck loose. Mitch slips away down the corridor unnoticed. INT. KANON’S OFFICE - DAY Mitch closes the door and hurries to Kanon’s filing cabin Its locked. He crosses to her desk and sits. Begins searching through drawers and paperwork as --  71. EXT. POLICE STATION - BACK BAY — DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kanon’s car pulls out of the parking lot. Then stops. She checks her bag. She’s forgotten her phone -- which we’1l know as we CUT TO -- INT. KANON’S OFFICE - DAY KANON’S CELL PHONE lying on her desk -- as Mitch looks through papers. Sits back. He’s getting nothing. He switches on her computer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kanon climbs from her car and walks toward the station entrance. INT. KANON’S OFFICE - DAY Mitch does a search for “TOBIAS LEVY” documents and a str of stuff comes up. Mitch searches down the list and finds Word document titled -- “POSSIBLE CONNECTED CASES?” -- and opens it. Sees a short list of UNSOLVED MURDERS an case numbers. Mitch hits PRINT. But the MACHINE just flashes -- out of paper. Shit. Mitch digs KEYS out of his pocket -- the FOB is a USB THU DRIVE -- and slots it into the computer as -- INT. POLICE STATION — DAY Kanon walks into the chaos in the lobby. Cops restraining the agitated drunks...

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: What the hell’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK 1
dialogues.text: I want my soda. The DA said I get a soda!

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: What DA?

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: I don’t know what the hell he’s talking about? Kanon strides past them --  72. INT. KANON'S OFFICE — DAY Mitch copies the document to his thumb-drive, unplugs it, shuts the computer down as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kanon strides along. ANOTHER OFFICER approaches her with paperwork -- INT. KANON’S OFFICE / ANOTHER CORRIDOR - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch hurries out of the office, closing the door behind and strides toward a corner in the corridor -- is about t walk into Kanon coming the other way -- until he HEARS --

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER OFFICER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey Kanon, can I ask you about this report? -- and Mitch darts sideways through A BATHROOM DOOR as Ka strides into view --

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: (to Officer--) Give me a minute. And she passes the bathroom. Sees her office door is clos She pushes it open and walks in to find -- The office is deserted. Behind her, Mitch strides out of the bathroom and around corner, heading for the exit. EXT. POLICE STATION - BACK BAY — DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch hurries across the street and gets into his Escalad He breathes, clutching the thumb drive, and drives away. INT. KANON'’S OFFICE — MORNING Kanon can’t help feeling she missed something. She crosse to her desk, reaches for her CELL PHONE and notices -- THE BLINKING LIGHT on the printer. Kanon grabs paper from a cupboard, slots it in the tray a the printer spits out the list of possible connected case Kanon looks at it. Putting 2 and 2 together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MITCH’S OFFICE - DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart walks in and sees Mitch scribbling information on whiteboard beneath 8 photographs. The last two are Cecil Ackerman and Victor Gonzales...

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: What’s all this?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Shut the door. Stuart closes the door...

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: That’s Ackerman and the guy from the news. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I need to figure out what links all these men. How he’s picking them and why.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: How who’s picking them?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Tobias Levy.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: These are the unsolved homicides that Kanon said matched Levy’s m.o.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Levy's innocent. The witness proved that.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I wish it were that simple.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: What’s going on, Mitch? First you almost blow the Levy case and get yourself disbarred and now you’re trying to prove he’s the Boston Strangler.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: If I could explain, Stu, I would. Stuart sighs...  74.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: What have you got so far?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: All these men were murdered with what the pathologists thinks were tools. The first took place eight months after Levy’s family was killed. He'd already had a run-in with the law after hospitalizing those three men, so lets assume he needed time to get up his courage again.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: So he kills Bob Smith.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: But why? Was it random? A loss of control? I don’t think so. I think he picked him. He picked all of them. So what do they all have in common?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Ackerman was a child molester.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: None of the others were. Though they do all have criminal records.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: So does half this city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy’s van pulls into the graveyard and parks. INT. MITCH’S OFFICE - DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: You say it started with the death of his family. Remind me what happened there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy walks through the graves carrying flowers. MITCH’S VOICE (V.O.) A man broke into their home and butchered his wife and daughter.  75. Levy reaches the grave of his wife and daughter. He remov the wilting flowers from a vase. INT. MITCH’S OFFICE - DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: The killer made Levy watch everything. Then slit his throat and left him for dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy stands looking at the grave. At the framed photo of wife and daughter standing beside the flowers. MITCH'’S VOICE (V.O.) It’s a miracle he survived. Levy absently touches his throat. We see the FAINT SCAR beneath his stubble. INT. MITCH’S OFFICE - DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: So he was tortured. And all these men were tortured, too.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: But of all the ex-cons in Boston, why target these specific men? A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: You really can’t tell me why you’re doing this?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You're going to make DA, one day, Stu. It’s best you stay as far away from this as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch walks through the stacks clutching a piece of paper with numbers written on it. INT. READING ROOM —- BOSTON LIBRARY — DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch is sitting at a desk. He has a stack of binders containing NEWSPAPERS inside. He thumbs through the pages  76. Finds the news story: “HOME INVASION MASSACRE.”

dialogues.speaker: MICROFICHE BLURS
dialogues.text: and settles on another story -- INT. MICRO-FICHE ROOM - BOSTON LIBRARY — DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch reads the “GAS STATION SHOOTING” story on the scree before him. He zooms in on areas of text. Finds the man w murdered Levy’s family was -- “career criminal”... “in and out of prison”... “recently paroled”... Mitch moves on. Then stops. Backtracks. Focuses on the word -- “PAROLED”. Mitch turns from the Microfish machine and digs into his briefcase. Pulls out files on each of the victims. Skims through pages. Finds the words -- INSERT - “RECENT PAROLEE”. He moves on. Skims the next file. Finds -- INSERT - “PAROLED” He skims Cecil Ackerman’s file. Finds the same thing. Mitch sits back. Pondering this fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low-rent neighborhood of liquor stores and welfare hous Mitch's Escalade drives into the run-down street. INT/EXT. MITCH’S ESCALADE (MOVING) - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch has the scrap of paper that Doyle gave him. He park outside the “halfway house”. EX-CONS are sitting on the steps smoking and talking. Mitch gets out and approaches them. Asks about Doyle. The gesture to a bar down the street.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark as a dungeon. Mitch walk down the steps and looks around the gloom. There is A MAN slumped at a table. Mitc approaches him and lifts his head. It’s not Doyle. A noise. Mitch looks round and sees Doyle coming in from storage carrying a crate of beers. He works here. Doyle sees Mitch standing over the drunk.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: That’s what you think of me, huh? Doyle puts the crate down and begins stocking the fridge. Mitch approaches him...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: So, talk. Doyle continues to work...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: I thought you didn’t need anybody's help.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: We made a mistake. That man we freed. He’s a serial killer. Doyle slows. Shakes his head...

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: He broke into my house. He threatened Rachel and Ella. Now he has Doyle’s attention. Mitch holds his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You're serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. BACK ALLEY - BEHIND BAR — DAY Doyle and Mitch step out of the bar. Doyle stacks a crate empty bottles. Looks around. The alley is deserted.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: So, the only reason Ackerman was in the road that night was because he was running from Levy.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: And after you left he finished the job.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Exactly. I was so wrapped up in my own guilt that I didn’t see the evidence for what it was. I didn’t even stop to ask why Ackerman was out in the rain without a coat. With no shoes on. And his eyes. He was begging me not to leave him. I thought he was just scared...

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I've got to do something.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Leave it the fuck alone.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: You're going to have to.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: He all but told me he’s going to kill again. I can’t live with that.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: I think you’re forgetting -- I perjured myself -- you left the scene of an accident, manipulated a trail --  79.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I know. It’s bad. But all we need is proof. Levy can’t be retried for Ackerman but if I can get evidence that he killed the other men, I can cut us both a deal. What you said under oath - what I did - that all goes away. Doyle nods -- it sounds logical --

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: So, what are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: We need to get inside his house and look around. He targeted those men. He tortured them. He may have overlooked something that links them to him.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: I’m on parole. I get caught breaking into some guy’s house...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I’'ll break in. All I need is for you to tail him. Warn me when he’s coming back.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: So, just a little aiding and abetting. (beat) This fucker really break into your house?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: While we were sleeping. Doyle weighs his options. He doesn’t have any...

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: He knows your ride. Rent me a clean set of wheels. I’11 meet you after my shift. Doyle goes back into the bar.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Thanks, Doyle. I mean it.  80.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: I may be an asshole, but I’m still your brother. Doyle lets the door close behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunder rumbles in the sky. A light rain falls. Levy walk out of his front door and locks the dead-bolt behind him. gets into his white van. Passes a new, grey, Dodge Challenger... INT/EXT. DOYLE’S CHALLENGER - CONTINUOUS Mitch and Doyle watch the van reach the end of the street Doyle starts the engine. It growls to life.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Listen to that engine. Man, this is a sweet ride.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: And it’s rented in my name so don’t scratch it.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Got full collision waiver, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Just call me in plenty of time to get out.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Chill, bro. I got this. Mitch gets out and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, Mitch - what’s your number again? Mitch pauses. Doyle laughs. Drives away with a ROAR of th engine. Mitch turns his collar up against the weather. He crosses the street toward --  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch glances up and down the deserted street. Slips thro the gate. EXT. SIDE PATH - LEVY’S HOUSE — CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overgrown. Mitch tries the back door. Locked. He looks through the glass. Sees a 50s style kitchen. Mitch moves toward the back garden. Notices a low basemen window. Pushes it with his foot. It moves. He gives it a stronger kick... INT. BASEMENT —- LEVY'S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bolt breaks free of the rotten frame. Mitch pushes th window open. Slides inside feet first. Lands. Mitch pulls a pen-light from his pocket and looks around room piled with boxes and furniture. Levy’s entire family life in boxes. Framed photos of Levy with his wife and daughter. Stuffed toys. Anything luxurious. EXT. FULLER'S AUTO REPAIR SHOP —- AFTERNOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy's van drives in through the gate and parks. Doyle’s Challenger pulls up across the street. INT. DOYLE’S CHALLENGER —- AFTERNOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle looks through the chain-link fence. A fork-lift dri past carrying a crate of tires. Levy goes inside the factory. Doyle kills the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basement door opens and Mitch steps up into the hallw The walls are bare. Pale squares show where family photos used to hang. Mitch goes into -- INT. LIVING ROOM —- LEVY'S HOUSE -— CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and sees the TV, sitting on a folding table. One woode chair faces it. Newspapers are piled beside it, like a coffee table. A week of microwave meal trays are piled on the papers. A fly buzzes in the air... INT/EXT. DOYLE’S CHALLENGER - AFTERNOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle presses eject on the CD player. Bored. A Barry Manillow CD pops out. Doyle drops it out the window. Sees Levy getting into his van. Doyle starts the engine. Levy pulls out of the Repair Shop grounds. Drives away.  82. Doyle starts to pull out after him. A passing car HONKS. Doyle stomps on the brakes. INT. LEVY’S VAN (MOVING) - AFTERNOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy looks in the mirror. Sees the Grey Challenger. INT. DOYLE’S CHALLENGER —- AFTERNOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle waits impatiently. Pulls into traffic. INT. BEDROOM —- LEVY'S HOUSE - AFTERNOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch opens the bedroom door and looks inside the empty r Monastic is the best description. A sweat-stained bed. A crucifix hangs on the wall. Mitch approaches the night-st and picks up the bible resting there. His cellphone rings. Loud. Mitch jumps.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: (into phone) Doyle? DOYLE’S VOICE (0.S.) Scare ya’?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Is he coming back? INT. DOYLE’S CHALLENGER (MOVING) - AFTERNOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle is driving a few cars behind Levy’s white van.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Nah. I’m just checking in. See how it’s going. INT. LEVY’S VAN (MOVING) - AFTERNOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy looks in the rear view mirror at the Grey Challenger few cars back. At Doyle talking on a phone. Levy fires his blinkers and turns off the main road. Look in his mirror again. Sees the Challenger turn also... Levy reaches over to the police scanner and fires it up. Police radio chatter fills the van... INT. LEVY’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON Mitch flicks through the Bible. Sees whole passages have been marked and highlighted.  83.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: The guy has nothing in his house except a Bible, a TV and microwave meals. It’s like he can’t bear to be reminded of his wife and kid. He’s hidden everything in the basement. DOYLE’S VOICE (0.S.) Anything tying him to the victims? Mitch picks a calendar off the wall. Every day has the schedule of some self-help group or other...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Not so far. It looks like the man eats and sleeps here ... but that’s about it. INT. DOYLE’'S CHALLENGER (MOVING) - EVENING Doyle is still tailing Levy. They approach a huge cement factory. The signs on the billowing stacks read CEMEX WOR But just before they reach it -- The white van turns off the road, through a chain-link ga toward an --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Levy parks outside. Weeds are overgrowing. Windows boarded up. Walls graffiti scarred. MITCH’S VOICE (0.S.) He spends the rest of his time at self-help groups. Doyle parks on the road and watches as Levy gets out, un- padlocks a door, and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He sometimes goes to two a night.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Now that’s just masochistic. I only have to go to one and that’s enough for me. INT. LEVY’S HOUSE —- EVENING Mitch continues to search through empty rooms. Sees one t was obviously the daughter’s room from the girly wallpape  84.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What do you mean “have to”?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: It’s one of the conditions of my parole.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You’re court ordered to go?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: A lot of ex-cons are. Mitch walks into the hallway and back down the stairs..

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And a lot of them need it. Doyle keeps watching the factory. Where the hell is Levy?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: I mean, I don’t know how some of them even swung parole - they’re so obviously going to re-offend.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: They admit that?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Right there in group. Mind racing... Mitch stops. Looks at the calendar.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: That's it. That’s how he picks them.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Mitch's view of Levy making coffee at the back of the chu hall. Listening while the group of men talk...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nobody notices the guy making coffee. He just hangs around - listening - like a fly on the wall. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And when he hears somebody who says they’1l re-offend...

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: He offs them. Doyle sees Levy walk out of the factory carrying a hammer away from his van. He disappears from view behind an old wall...

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (silent) What the hell? Doyle looks around. Can’t see Levy anywhere...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: He’s stopping what happened to his family from happening again. Mitch's foot CREAKS on a floorboard. He stops. Backsteps. It creaks again. He bends and feels the edge. Lifts it to reveal -- A CAVITY beneath the floor. He digs his arm in.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hang on. I think I’ve found something. Mitch pulls out a black plastic bag. He opens it. Inside finds --

dialogues.speaker: MASSACHUSETTS IDS
dialogues.text: -- for all the victims. Cecil Ackermann, Victor Gonzales etc...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He kept their IDs. Doyle gets out of the car and looks around the deserted street. The noise of the Cemex Works fills the air. Mitch HEARS it through the phone...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s that noise?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: It’s the cement works. Mitch leaves the bag of IDs and hurries to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and looks out at the billowing stacks of the Cemex Wor only a few blocks away - beyond the opposite row of house

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Is he coming back?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: No, we've stopped. He went inside some old warehouse, then came out again carrying a hammer and I lost him.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Carrying what?

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: A hammer. Doyle SENSES somebody behind him and turns as --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Doyle, get out of -- ! BAM! The hammer smashes Doyle across the face and sends h slamming into the car window. Glass SHATTERS on impact. INT. LEVY’S HOUSE —- EVENING

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Doyle?! Mitch REACTS. Runs for the front door. Rips it open. The CAMERA takes in the bag of IDs still lying on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch charges down the path and shoves through the gate. SLAMS into an OLD MAN walking his dog. Mitch runs straight across the street and into another garden. Shoulders through the side gate. EXT. A SERIES OF SHOTS —- EVENING Mitch barrels through a back garden. Leaps at the fence. Scrambles over. Lands in an alley. Runs on through puddles. Shoulders through another gate.  87. Through another garden. Over another fence. Runs on. Back out into another street. A BUICK slams on the brakes. Mitch leaps. Slides across t hood. Runs on. Feet pounding the asphalt. The smoke, billowing from the Cemex works, getting closer

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hang on, Doyle. I’m coming. Mitch rounds a corner into the street leading to -- EXT. ABANDONED WAREHOUSE — CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch sees Doyle’s Challenger by the roadside. The broken window. The blood. Sees Levy's white van parked by the abandoned factor. Mitch runs toward it with grim determination. Runs straight toward the unlocked warehouse door. Rips it open. Barrels inside. No thought for his own safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the Cemex works booms through the dank, cavernous space...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Doyle?! Doyle, where are you?! Mitch HEARS a noise above. Bolts toward the stairs. INT. STAIRWELL — ABANDONED WAREHOUSE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch pounds upward, three steps at a time and -- INT. SECOND FLOOR —- ABANDONED WAREHOUSE — CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- hits the upper hallway. Mitch follows the noise. Runs toward the wall of plastic sheeting that hangs at the end He bursts through the plastic wall and into --  88. INT. KILL ROOM —- ABANDONED WAREHOUSE - CONTINUOUS Mitch sees Doyle on the floor. Twitching in a pool of blo Beaten and broken. Blood oozing from his cracked skull. Tools glistening with blood lie around him...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: No! EXT. ABANDONED WAREHOUSE — AFTERNOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy climbs into his white van, carrying Doyle’s cellphon We see him dial 911 as he starts the engine...

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: (into phone; acts desperate) Help me. Please. Mitch Brody is trying to kill me... EXT. ABANDONED WAREHOUSE — AFTERNOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don’t hear the rest of the conversation. The white van drives calmly away. Thunder rumbles in the sky and a driz rain starts to fall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch tries to stem Doyle’s bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Stay with me, Doyle. Stay with me. Mitch tries to dial 911. His iPhone has no signal.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. Come on. Come on. He moves it around. Gets one bar. Dials again.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need an ambulance. (a garbled response) Hello? The call disconnects. He tries again. It disconnects. Frustration builds.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Doyle, I’m going to have to move you. I’m sorry. It’s going to hurt. Mitch scoops Doyle up into his arms and lifts him.  89. Doyle ROARS in pain.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay with me, brother. Stay with me. Mitch carries Doyle through the plastic sheets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch hurries along the upper hallway and down the stairs Every footfall is excruciating for Doyle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR distant police sirens approach. See PATROL CARS c into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noise of the Cemex works booms. Mitch carries Doyle toward the door. Kicks through it into the daylight as -- EXT. ABANDONED WAREHOUSE — CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cars skid to a halt in the drizzle rain. Cops spew out of them as -- Mitch appears, drenched in blood, carrying Doyle in his a

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Help me. He needs a doctor. Cops draw their guns at the sight. Aim them at Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: COPS
dialogues.text: (ad lib) On your knees. Put him down. Cops move in on Mitch as he drops to his knees holding Do

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Help him. Please. Boom! Doyle is pulled from him. Mitch is slammed into the mud. Knees in his spine. Hands cuffed behind his back. A COP checks Doyle’s pulse and begins CPR on him. Mitch and Doyle stare into each others eyes across the mu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. INTERVIEW ROOM —- POLICE STATION - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Mitch is seated. Cuffed. Covered in dry mud and Doyle’s blood. INT. LOBBY —- POLICE STATION - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone rings. Activity. Rachel stands before the Desk Sergeant. Ella cries...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I demand to see my husband, right now.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: I can’t do that. He hasn’t been processed.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What is he even being charged with?

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: I can’t tell you that either.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That’s ridiculous. I’m his wife!

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Listen, lady. Your baby is cold and unhappy. Why don’t you take her home and I’11 call you as soon as you can see him. Okay? He slides a pad of paper and pen over to her. DESK SERGEANT (CONT’D) I can’t say fairer than that now, can I? She writes down her number...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. INTERVIEW ROOM —- POLICE STATION - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kanon walks in and sits opposite Mitch...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: How’s Doyle?

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Mr. Logan is still in surgery, but the prognosis looks hopeful.  gl. Mitch visibly relaxes...

dialogues.speaker: KANON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to tell me what your relationship is to him?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: We're stepbrothers -- our parents just never married. Kanon nods. Understands now...

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Which is why he’d purger himself for you in court.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Exactly. Mitch feels like a dick for every bad thing he said to Do

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: So, why turn on him now?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Was he blackmailing you? Had he had enough of what you were doing?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I didn't do this. Tobias Levy did it. Kanon slides a photo across the table. It’s of the bloody hammer...

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Using your hammer.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Yes! He broke into my house and stole my tools.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: There were no other prints on the hammer than yours.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Then he wore gloves. I called 911 for Christ sake. Why would I do that if I was guilty?  92.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: You tell me. You did it on the 4th.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What? Kanon plays the 911 call.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: 911 what’s your emergency? MITCH’S VOICE (0.S.) (muffled) There’s been an accident. A young Man was run over by a car. Kanon presses stop...

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Or are you going to deny that’s you?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: No. I mean, yes, that’s me. I did it. I hit him with my car and I left. But I was scared -- I'd been drinking. It was an accident --

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: And was Doyle an accident?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I didn’t hurt, Doyle. I wouldn't hurt anyone!

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Except Ackerman. We found this in the bottom of your toolbox. Kanon slides a plastic evidence bag across the desk towar him. Mitch’s business card is covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: That's because Levy put it there!

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: It has two types of blood on it --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I’m being framed!  93.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: -- and by your own admission we can now link you to three victims.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ - can you think logically? Why would I do this? What’s my motive? And if I was the killer why didn’t I crucify Levy in court? He was the perfect scapegoat.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: You tell me. Mitch SLAMS the table with his cuffed fists.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Because I’m innocent! Kanon just sits and looks at him. Mitch breathes...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Listen to me. There’s a bag.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: A bag.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Levy kept the IDs of all his victims. He’s targeting violent parolees who are going to re- offend. Like the man who murdered his family.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Where is this bag?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: In Levy’s house.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: In his house?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: And you know this how?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I broke in.  94.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: How do I know you didn’t plant them?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Because I didn’t! Jesus, detective, I know you've only got 24 hours in the day but even you must have given a shit about the truth at some point. Kanon just looks at him. She’s like a stone wall and it’s time for Mitch to stop banging his head off it --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t think I should answer anything else until I have a lawyer present.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: That's probably the first honest thing you've said. Kanon stands and walks out of the room. The door clunks closed behind her. Mitch puts his head in his hands and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kanon pauses outside the door of the interview room. She pauses. Something in her face makes us think that maybe s does believe Mitch -- a little. She walks away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time passes. We see the workings of the police station. INT. KANON’S OFFICE - NIGHT Kanon is at her desk. She slaps a baseball from palm to palm. Lost in thought. She looks at her computer. A beat. She puts down the ball and fires types on the keyboard. INSERT SCREEN - the words “MURDERED PAROLEES” appear in a search field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MIDDLE AGED COP (TRAVIS), should have gone home hours a walks along the corridor. Pulls a bunch of keys from his pocket and unlocks the door to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis opens the door. Mitch is still sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Your lawyer’s on the phone. Travis un-cuffs Mitch from the table. Leads him out into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis leads Mitch to the payphone on the corridor wall. Steps away as Mitch picks up the handset.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Stuart, where the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: LEVY'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mitch. This was the only way I could get to talk to you. Mitch goes cold. Grips the phone...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Listen to me, you sonofabitch, you almost killed my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked at the side of a quiet suburban street.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: That was your fault, not mine.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I will get you.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: If only you’d have had this much backbone that night in the rain. You could have waited for the ambulance and Ackerman would still be alive. Of course then he’d be free to continue raping small children. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: LEVY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You do know that’s what he was about to do when I grabbed him, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: I want to help you.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Then turn yourself in.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: That's funny, but no. I believe you were faced with the same exact choice to ruin my life or your own. Yet you found a third option.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You don’t have a third option.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: That’s not true. If another murder with the same m.o. happens while you're in custody they’d have no choice but to acknowledge your innocence --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: That’s insane --

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: -- and by the time the police turn their attention back to me, I'1l have moved on. New name. New state. Consider it a parting gift.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You don’t know the police would even connect the murder to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy watches Rachel drive past in her Prius and pull up t driveway to Mitch’s house.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: Oh, believe me, they’1ll connect it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel hits the garage-door remote and --  97. INT. POLICE STATION —- BACK BAY - NIGHT Mitch recognizes the house-rattling CLUNK of his garage d as it begins to rise. His eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: No! Click. The line goes dead. Mitch stabs the buttons...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait! Mitch holds down the cutoff buttons and then starts to di Nothing. Tries again...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shouts ) Line! I need a line! Tries the phone again. Travis walks toward him...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need an outside line. It’s an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: You only get one call.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: He’s after my wife!

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: You only get one call. Mitch grabs Travis.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You're not listening to me. He’s going to kill my wife! Travis slams Mitch against the wall. Cranks his arm up hi back. OTHER COPS come running...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I_have to warn her! Travis hooks a cuff on Mitch’s wrist. Mitch grimaces in pain. If the other cuff gets on he’s done for. Mitch plants a foot on the wall and pushes backwards with his strength. Slams Travis into the opposite wall.  98. Mitch drives his head back into Travis’ face. His nose breaks. Travis releases him. Mitch pulls the 9mm from Travis’ holster. Zeros the approaching Cops.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay back. Mitch pulls Travis in front of him like a shield. Jams th gun into Travis’ throat.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’'ll shoot him. I swear to God. Mitch glances behind him and looks at the EXIT sign. Pull Travis backwards with him. INT. KANON’S OFFICE - NIGHT Kanon sees Cops run past her office door. Pulling guns. She gets a bad feeling. Rises from her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch pushes back against the emergency exit bar. The doo opens. An ALARM sounds. Mitch looks out into the indoor parking lot. It looks deserted. INT. INDOOR PARKING LOT - POLICE STATION — CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch pulls Travis inside and slams the door again. Grabs Travis’ nightstick and jams it through the handles as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops shoulder the door. It won’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: COPS
dialogues.text: Go around! INT. PARKING LOT —- POLICE STATION —- NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch marches Travis toward a Patrol Car. Opens the door. The ignition is empty.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Where’s the key?  99.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: In the lock-box. Travis indicates the valet-style cupboard on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Mitch pistol whips Travis. He drops to the floor. Mitch rushes to the lock-box. It won’t open. He points the gun the lock and -- BOOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kanon runs in as the GUNSHOT echoes through the station. There are monitors covering all areas.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Who’s shooting? The POLICE WOMAN manning the monitors looks at her...

dialogues.speaker: POLICE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Your suspect. On a monitor, Kanon sees the image change to Mitch clambe into a Patrol Car with a gun. She sees the Cop lying on t concrete. Not moving...

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: (to police woman) Close the gate. (into radio) Officer down. Repeat - Officer is down. Suspect is in the parking lot. He is armed and dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops grab M-16s from the rack. Head toward the parking lo at a run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch fumbles the key. Fires the engine. Slams the shifte into reverse. Tires smoke. He shoots backwards. Hits the brakes. Slams her into first and zooms toward the exit ga He sees the gate closing. Mitch guns the gas and --  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! The Patrol Car RIPS one of the metal gates clean of its hinges. Sparks fly. Metal rends, but the car’s “bull bars" protect the engine. Mitch zooms toward the road as M-16s open fire on the car. BULLET HITS snake across the rear doors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch ducks as the rear windows IMPLODE. Bullet hits POP rear seat. Stuffing turns to confetti. Mitch slaloms out into traffic. Other cars shield him fro more gunfire...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PARKING LOT —- POLICE STATION —- NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kanon approaches Cop. He is coming around. Head bleeding. Other Cops helping him.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: COPS
dialogues.text: He got a phone call and went crazy.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: A call from who?

dialogues.speaker: COPS
dialogues.text: His lawyer. He was ranting about making another call. Said somebody was going to kill his wife.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Who?!

dialogues.speaker: COPS
dialogues.text: I don’t know. He just kept saying it.

dialogues.speaker: STUART, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’s going on? Kanon looks and sees Stuart standing there with his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Who are you?  101.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Stuart Kemp. DA’s office. I’m Mitch Brody’s lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: (urgent-—-) Did you just call Mitch?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: No. And Kanon runs toward her car --

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Get Brody’s home address. Have it sent to my phone. She jumps behind the wheel and fires the engine...

dialogues.speaker: KANON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shouts ) Tell SWAT and tactical to meet me there! And somebody call the wife! She pulls out. Tires smoking...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MITCH’S HOUSE - NIGHT The doorbell rings. Rachel answers it. Levy is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Brody?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: I'm detective Kanon. I'd like to talk to you about your husband if you don't mind? We HEAR Ella cry inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. Not at all. One second. Rachel disappears inside to fetch Ella. Levy glances arou the deserted street, steps inside and closes the door. The CAMERA moves away from the door to find the TELEPHONE WIRE running up the outside wall of the house.  102. It’s been cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel picks up Ella and turns to go back to the front do She sees Levy is now inside. It gives her pause.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: I hope you don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Not at all. Can you tell me what you've arrested my husband for?

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: Murder.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What? That's insane.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I know he didn't do it. Could I trouble you for a glass of water?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Of course. Rachel goes into -- INT. KITCHEN — MITCH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel puts Ella in her bassinet, on the kitchen table, a nudges a stack of Mitch's files. Papers spill onto the floor. They can wait.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don't understand. She grabs a glass and turns on the faucet.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you know he didn't do it, why are you holding him? INT. LIVING ROOM —- MITCH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy takes a leather tool-roll from inside his coat and unties it. He rolls out the set on the dining table. Chisels, blades, screwdrivers...

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: Other people don't believe it yet - but they will.  103. INT. KITCHEN — MITCH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel tests the water with her finger. Glances down at Mitch’s papers on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There's just something I need your help with first.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh? Rachel notices something among Mitch’s papers that makes blood freeze... INT. LIVING ROOM —- MITCH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy selects a brutal looking chisel. He walks toward the kitchen door. Stands to one side. Can HEAR the faucet running.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Would you like ice?

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: As it comes is fine. Levy steadies his breath. Clutching the chisel and - Nothing. The faucet continues to run.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mrs. Brody? Still nothing but the sound of running water.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello? Levy lowers the chisel and pushes through the door into - INT. KITCHEN — MITCH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faucet continues to run. Rachel is gone. Ella is missing from the bassinet. Levy sees the papers on the floor. Among them is -- LEVY'S MUG-SHOT. Suddenly, he HEARS the BEEP of the Prius alarm as the car unlocks. Levy races out of the kitchen toward the garage.  104. A beat. The pantry door opens and Rachel steps out clutching Ella the Prius keys/remote. She rushes toward the garage’s connecting door... INT. GARAGE - MITCH’S HOUSE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy looks inside the Prius. No sign of Rachel. He senses movement behind him. Spins to see -- Rachel slam and lock the connecting door. Levy flies back at it. Tries to shoulder the door. It won budge. He looks around and sees -- A DOUBLE-HANDED AX among Mitch’s tools. He grabs it and - INT. MITCH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Rachel, carrying Ella, moves back from the door and -- BOOM! The AX cleaves the wood. Rachel SCREAMS and runs back through the house.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT/EXT. MITCH’S PATROL CAR (MOVING) - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch slaloms through traffic at high speed. Leaning on t horn. Flashing his lights. He looks at the controls. Find the siren switch. The cherries flash and the siren wails. Traffic parts bef him like the red sea. Mitch guns the engine... INT. LIVING ROOM — MITCH’S HOUSE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel snatches up the phone. The line is dead. She HEARS the house-rattling CLUNK of the garage door opening. Rachel runs to the front door and tries to open it. It’s locked. She twists the dead bolt. Undoes the chain. Her hands shaking. Ella is crying... Rachel keeps looking back toward the garage corridor. No sign of Levy yet. Rachel rips open the front door and -- Levy runs toward her with the ax.  105. Rachel tries to SLAM the door again but Levy hits it with full weight and -- BOOM! He’s through. Rachel is flung backwards onto the stairs. She shields El from the impact. Levy hits the hall table and mirror. Shatters glass. Fall to the floor. Levy shakes it off. Scrambles for the ax as -- Rachel leaps to her feet and runs up the stairs. INT. UPPER HALLWAY - MITCH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel reaches the top of the stairs. Levy is coming up after her. She bolts through the bedroom door. Swings it shut behind her. Slam. Levy shoulders straight through the flimsy wood and into INT. BEDROOM — MITCH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is trapped. She backs around the bed. Into the corner. Levy catches his breath. Stalks her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What do you want? Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: Put the baby on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. Levy swings the ax and takes a lamp off the dresser. It shatters against the far wall.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: Put the baby on the bed!

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: Mitch skids the patrol car into his street. Guns it. Sees Levy's white van. He slams on the brakes outside --  106. EXT. MITCH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Mitch leaps out of the car clutching the stolen 9mm. Bolt up the driveway toward the open front door...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Rachel?! Mitch runs through the door into -- INT. MITCH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Mitch sees the shattered hall mirror. He runs into -- INT. LIVING ROOM —- MITCH’S HOSUE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch looks around. Gun ready. Sees the roll of tools on the dining table. He pushes open the kitchen door...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Rachel?! Where are you?! Mitch looks down the corridor and sees the axed garage do

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rachel?! Mitch bolts back into the hallway and up the stairs... INT. UPPER HALLWAY - MITCH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch pounds up the stairs and reaches the bedroom door. sees the splintered wood. Hears Ella whimpering inside. A muffled sob and -- INT. BEDROOM — MITCH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch bursts in. Gun up. He scopes the room and sees Levy standing behind Rachel. Ella is on the bed. Levy has the blade of the ax against Rachel’s throat like a knife.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mitch -- Levy flinches the blade. Shuts her up...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Don’t hurt her.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: Drop the gun. Mitch weighs up his options. He doesn’t have any. He take his finger off the trigger. Opens his palms. Drops the gu  107.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kick it towards me. Mitch kicks the gun to Levy's feet.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, Rachel, I want you to slowly bend with me. Rachel and Levy bend at the knees. Levy picks up the gun. They straighten. Levy sighs. He drops the ax. Mitch makes a move. Levy has the gun at Rachel’s temple in a flash. Mitch freezes.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Whatever you're thinking of doing, Tobias, don’t. Please. I’m out. My alibi’s shot. You don’t have to hurt them.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: You know too much. I don’t have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You do! You do have a choice. What happened to you was terrible, but doing this won’t change that.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: No, but you’ll finally understand why I do what I do.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Please. I already understand.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: No, you don’t. But you will -- Levy trips the hammer to fire and --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I understand that you watched your wife and child be butchered and you did nothing! Levy looks at him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you were a fucking coward! 108. Rachel stares at Mitch in horror. What is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: (angry) No! Mitch begins inching toward Levy...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You froze!

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You piece of shit! You cared more about saving yourself than your own flesh and blood.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You're lying! Mitch continues to inch forward. Goading Levy. to turn the gun away from Rachel, onto him.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Admit it!

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: He never should have been out of prison! It was the system’s fault.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: This isn’t about the system. It’s about you. If you were a_man you'd have died first! I know it -- and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: (screams ) There was nothing I could do! Mitch is almost to Levy now. Willing him  109.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Bullshit! You just don't have the balls to kill the one who deserves to die... (beat) You! Levy ROARS in pain. Swings the gun away from Rachel and stabs the barrel into Mitch's chest. Eyes blazing with murderous anger. Mitch stops. Rachel’s breath stops.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: What about you? Are you willing to die first?!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Yes. Mitch catches the barrel with both hands and clamps it fi to upper chest and --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rachel, run! Before Levy knows what’s happening, Rachel pulls away. Levy tries to turn the gun but Mitch holds on with an iro grip. This gun ain’t pointing at anybody but him. Rachel snatches Ella up from the bed. Levy FIRES. BOOM! A bullet shoots through Mitch’s shoulder. A vase behind him - across the room - EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch ROARS in pain but hangs onto the barrel. He’1l die before he’ll let go.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (screams ) Mitch!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Get out of here! Mitch staggers in pain but still grips the gun. Rachel is almost out of the room as --  110. BOOM! Another shot rips through Mitch’s shoulder -- shatt a family photo behind him -- and Mitch releases his grip. Almost collapses in pain. Levy turns the gun on Rachel and squeezes the trigger as

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nooooo! !!! Mitch drives his good shoulder into Levy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! The gun fires wide. Takes a chunk out of the door frame as -- Mitch tackles Levy backwards toward the window and -- EXT. UPPER WINDOWN - MITCH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass EXPLODES outward. Mitch and Levy fly out into space. They slam down through the branches of a young tree. Are spun apart. Hit more branches. Slam down into -- EXT. FRONT GARDEN - MITCH’S HOUSE — CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levy and Mitch both lie on the lawn. Gasping. In pain. Levy gets to his feet and bends to pick up the gun. He tu to Mitch and -- BAM! Mitch punches him in the face. Levy’s head snaps to side. Mitch hits him again. Levy drops the gun. Then swings a fist into Mitch’s bullet-ravaged shoulder. Mitch ROARS in pain. Drops to one knee. He only has his right arm. His left hangs impotently. Levy stands over him. Punches Mitch in the face. Grabs Mitch and drags him to his feet. Hits him again. And agai Mitch looks done-for. Then BAM! He punches his right fist into Levy’s kidney. And with all his remaining strength h drives his forehead into Levy's nose. BAM! The two men stagger apart.  111. Mitch collapses in pain and exhaustion. Shoulder pumping blood. He lies there gasping for air as -- Levy claws for the fallen gun. Blood streams from his bro nose. He climbs back to his feet and -- Stands over Mitch. Aims the gun down into his face. Mitch laughs through the pain.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You - are a - fucking - pussy.

dialogues.speaker: LEVY
dialogues.text: I was afraid, God help me. Are you? Levy thumbs the hammer back and --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: No. A flicker of hurt crosses Levy’s eyes. The only thing keeping him sane was that any man would have done what he did. Mitch has proved him wrong. WHAM! Rachel hits him in the back with the ax. Levy staggers in pain. Trying to reach the handle. He tur to look at Rachel. He raises the gun. Is going to shoot h when --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Noooo! Mitch tries to rise, but can’t, and -- BOOM! A bullet blows the back of Levy’s head out. Mitch looks around for the source of the bullet and sees

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: at the edge of the driveway. Gun raised. Smoke curls from the barrel. The SCREAM of more patrol cars fill the air. Lights flash... Mitch looks up at the stars above and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. EMERGENCY ROOM —- HOSPITAL - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch is sitting on a bed. His left shoulder and chest ar heavily bandaged. An IV gives him fluids. There are COPS standing guard at the edge of the curtained area. Mitch’s good arm is cuffed to the metal bed-frame. Kanon walks in past the cops.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Relieved.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Doctor said the bullets didn’t even clip a bone. You're lucky. Mitch looks past Kanon at Rachel and Ella...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I know. Kanon follows his look. She pulls keys from her pocket an uncuffs him...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: I think you’re family’s been through enough for one night, don’t you? Mitch looks at her. She’s serious.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Thank you. Kanon pockets the cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Don’t make the mistake of thinking a few bullets in the shoulder gets you off the hook, counselor, because it doesn’t. I'’11 expect you down at the station first thing tomorrow to give a full statement.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Understood. Kanon gestures to the Cops to let Rachel and Ella through  113.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If only I hadn’t left the accident.

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: Then you'd be behind bars and Levy would still be out there. Where’s the justice in that? Kanon is about to walk away when --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Any word on Doyle?

dialogues.speaker: KANON
dialogues.text: He’s in recovery. I hear he was lucky too. Mitch nods. Grateful. Kanon leaves as Rachel rushes in wi Ella and hugs Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. DOYLE’S RECOVERY ROOM - HOSPITAL - DAWN Doyle’s heart monitor beeps. He has IVs coming out of him and bandages covering his wounds and skull. His face is h swollen. Mitch enters the room, arm in a sling, and stands at his bedside.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Doyle? Doyle's eyes flicker open. He smiles. Sleepy but happy to see Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Hey. You bring me flowers?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I brought you something better. Rachel walks in carrying Ella.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is my wife, Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hello, Doyle. Doyle blinks and tries to sit up. It’s excruciating...  114.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Try not to move.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: And this is your niece. Mitch puts Ella into Doyle's arms. Doyle's eyes well up..

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Hello, Ella. Ella gurgles and smiles...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I guess we’ve got some catching up to do. Rachel sits on the side of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA pulls back. Looking in at Rachel, Mitch and Do talking. Doyle continues to hold Ella. They don’t yet loo like a family, but it’s a start... THE CAMERA takes in Boston and the rising sun. It’s going be a beautiful day.
